  proposition: Nina Panickssery, Nick Gabrieli, Julian Schulz, Meg Tong, Evan Hubinger, and Alexander Matt Turner authored a paper on steering Llama 2 via contrastive activation addition.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Nina Panickssery|AUTHORED|Research Paper

  proposition: Elias Stengel-Eskin, Peter Hase, and Mohit Bansal researched teaching models to balance resisting and accepting persuasion.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Elias Stengel-Eskin|RESEARCHED|Model
    Peter Hase|RESEARCHED|Model
    Mohit Bansal|RESEARCHED|Model

  proposition: Philippe Laban, Lidiya Murakhovs'ka, Caiming Xiong, and Chien-Sheng Wu investigated performance drops in LLMs through challenging experiments.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Philippe Laban|INVESTIGATED|Large Language Models
    Lidiya Murakhovs'ka|INVESTIGATED|Large Language Models
    Caiming Xiong|INVESTIGATED|Large Language Models

  proposition: Zihao Yi, Jiarui Ouyang, Yuwen Liu, Tianhao Liao, Zhe Xu, and Ying Shen conducted a survey on recent advances in LLM-based multi-turn dialogue systems.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Zihao Yi|CONDUCTED|Survey
    Jiarui Ouyang|CONDUCTED|Survey
    Yuwen Liu|CONDUCTED|Survey

    Ying Shen|RESEARCHED|Multi-turn Dialogue Systems

  proposition: Qiaoyu Tang, Ziliang Deng, Hongyu Lin, Xianpei Han, Qiao Liang, and Le Sun developed Toolalpaca for generalized tool learning with 3000 simulated cases.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Toolalpaca|DEVELOPED_WITH|3000 simulated cases
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Qiaoyu Tang|DEVELOPED|Toolalpaca
    Ziliang Deng|DEVELOPED|Toolalpaca
    Hongyu Lin|DEVELOPED|Toolalpaca
    Xianpei Han|DEVELOPED|Toolalpaca
    Qiao Liang|DEVELOPED|Toolalpaca
    Le Sun|DEVELOPED|Toolalpaca

  proposition: Rui Yang, Lin Song, Yanwei Li, Sijie Zhao, Yixiao Ge, Xiu Li, and Ying Shan created GPT4Tools for teaching large language models to use tools via self-instruction.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Rui Yang|CREATED|GPT4Tools
    Lin Song|CREATED|GPT4Tools
    Yanwei Li|CREATED|GPT4Tools
    Sijie Zhao|CREATED|GPT4Tools
    Yixiao Ge|CREATED|GPT4Tools
    Xiu Li|CREATED|GPT4Tools
    Ying Shan|CREATED|GPT4Tools

  proposition: Hanning Zhang and colleagues developed R-Tuning to teach large language models to refuse unknown questions, winning an Outstanding Paper Award at NAACL 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    R-Tuning|AWARDED|Outstanding Paper Award
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Hanning Zhang|DEVELOPED|R-Tuning
    Hanning Zhang|AWARDED|Outstanding Paper Award at NAACL 2024

  proposition: Yuqing Yang, Ethan Chern, Xipeng Qiu, Graham Neubig, and Pengfei Liu researched alignment for honesty in language models.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Yuqing Yang|RESEARCHED|Language Model Honesty
    Ethan Chern|RESEARCHED|Language Model Honesty
    Xipeng Qiu|RESEARCHED|Language Model Honesty
    Graham Neubig|RESEARCHED|Language Model Honesty
    Pengfei Liu|RESEARCHED|Language Model Honesty

  proposition: Qinyuan Cheng and team investigated whether AI assistants can recognize their own knowledge limitations.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Qinyuan Cheng|INVESTIGATED|AI Assistants
    Qinyuan Cheng|RESEARCHED|AI Assistant Knowledge Limitations

  proposition: Amanda Askell and colleagues explored a general language assistant as a laboratory for alignment.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Amanda Askell|EXPLORED|Language Assistant
    Amanda Askell|RESEARCHED|Alignment

  proposition: Rongwu Xu and researchers examined LLMs' beliefs towards misinformation through persuasive conversations.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Rongwu Xu|EXAMINED|Large Language Models
    Rongwu Xu|RESEARCHED|Misinformation Beliefs

  proposition: Yuchen Zhuang and team created ToolQA, a dataset for LLM question answering with external tools.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Yuchen Zhuang|CREATED|ToolQA
    Yuchen Zhuang|DEVELOPED|Dataset for LLM Question Answering

  proposition: Hyuhng Joon Kim and colleagues worked on aligning language models to explicitly handle ambiguity.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Hyuhng Joon Kim|RESEARCHED|Language Model Alignment
    Hyuhng Joon Kim|WORKED_ON|Ambiguity Handling

  proposition: Duzhen Zhang and researchers reviewed recent advances in multimodal large language models.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Duzhen Zhang|REVIEWED|Multimodal Large Language Models

  proposition: Baolin Peng and team conducted instruction tuning with GPT-4.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Baolin Peng|CONDUCTED|Instruction Tuning
    Baolin Peng|USED|GPT-4

  proposition: Kyle Mahowald and colleagues investigated the dissociation of language and thought in large language models.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Kyle Mahowald|INVESTIGATED|Language and Thought Dissociation in Large Language Models
